page.title: 02ECOLOGY OF ALVINGTON
page.content: Alvington is situated on the North Bank of the Severn Estuary in the county of Gloucestershire and is approximately 100 feet above sea level. The climate of the area is damp and windy with quite severe winters. It is a very rural, unspoilt area. Conservation and wildlife are therefore helped greatly with hedgerows and mudflats. Migrating birds and geese make use of the mudflats on route to and from the Slimbridge Wild Bird sanctuary on the other side of the river. Footpaths are clearly defined. There are three family owned farms in the area. One of the farms _ Alvington Court farm _ was mentioned in the original Doomsday Book. All three are dairy and sheep farms. Also because the river Severn is tidal salmon and elver fishing take place,
